title: Can some opinions be objectively true? - Quora

response.answer_text: I would say yes.   An opinion could be a hypothesis unsupported by evidence known to the holder of the opinion.  But that evidence might elsewhere exist. So I could hold the opinion that there must be sentient life on other planets, based on probability for example. If that sentient life does exist then my opinion is objectively true (even though neither I nor anyone else on the planet can demonstrate that it is so.)

The very definition of opinion is that it is subjective so no, it cannot be objectively true unless the statement is backed up by cold, hard facts in which case it is no longer an opinion, it is a fact.
